City Council

Candidate Eligibility Requirements

Eligibility for City Council candidacy during an election is governed by Title 9, Sec 141.001 of the State of Texas Election Code and by Section 3.03 of the City of Watauga Home Rule Charter.  In any case in which the requirements are more restrictive in the City's Home Rule Charter as opposed to the State Election Code, the requirements in the City of Watauga Home Rule Charter prevail.

  • State of Texas Election Code Title 9
  • City of Watauga Home Rule Charter and Code of Ordinances

Form of Government

Watauga is led by a Mayor/Council/City Manager form of government, with the Mayor and all seven (7) City Council seats elected at-large for a three year term. Direct citizen input to City government takes the form of several volunteer boards, commissions and committees, which advise the City Council on a variety of issues such as crime prevention, parks, recreation and community services, etc.

Council Members

Terms of office for members of the city council shall be three years, in accordance with the following schedule. In May of 2025, the mayor and councilmembers in places 3, 4 and 5 shall be elected to terms of office of three years. In May of 2026, councilmembers in places 1, 2, 6 and 7 shall be elected to terms of office of three years. In May of 2027, and in May of each third year thereafter, no general election for mayor or councilmembers will be held, unless to fill a vacancy in office as may be needed.urrent Members

Mayor Arthur L. Miner
Pat Shelbourne - Place 1

Mayor Pro Tem Cris Blackburn

Lovie Downey - Place 3
Andrew Neal - Place 4
Vacant - Place 5
Mark Taylor - Place 6
Jan Hill - Place 7


Meetings

Watauga City Council Regular Meetings are approved a year in advance by City Council and are generally scheduled on the second and fourth Monday of each month.  When approving the Regular Meeting schedule, City Council takes into consideration various factors such as holidays and Charter provisions.  Special City Council Meetings are called as needed and notice of all meetings can be found on the required bulletin boards at City Hall.  Regular City Council Meetings and Special City Council Meetings are held at City Hall in the City Council Chamber located at 7105 Whitley Road, Watauga, Texas 76148.  

Agendas are posted on-line in compliance with the Texas Open Meetings Act and are available for you to view at your convenience. 

Agendas, Minutes and Streaming

Please check the city meeting calendar before arrival, as meetings may be canceled.
